reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is an old hotel but it has been well maintained. It is spotlessly clean. Free breakfast is what you would expect. Everything was fresh. Yes, the hallways are not heated but who sleeps in the hallways? Room was very comfortable. Bathroom is very small but then it's only a toilet and a tub. the swimming pool is always warm for a nice relaxing dip before bed. Whenever we are visiting York, we always stay here. the guys at thefront desk are always willing to help if yu have a problem.
reviews.title: We always stay here
Not So Bad
reviews.text: Read lots of bad reviews about this spot. I have to say, I was pretty happy. Yes, there is no heat in the hallways and the breakfast could use some yogurt and fruit BUT the room was extremely clean, no musty smells as reported in other reviews, although on Route 1, it was VERY quiet, great access to where I needed to go.. Oh, and front desk people were kind and pleasant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a nice stay here. The motel is close enough to Kittery for good outlet shopping. Our only issue is their bathroom setup. The toilet is in a room with the tub and is way too tight a fit for anyone and is very uncomfortable as a result. Your elbows hit the wall even. Otherwise the hotel is fine. Having a refrigerator was nice.
reviews.title: Hotel is great but toilets are tiny!

reviews.text: Some friends and I booked this hotel for a girls shopping weekend in Kittery. We weren't looking for a fancy hotel so we thought the Best Western would be sufficient for one night. Boy, were we wrong! As soon as we walked in the room we noticed a stain on the comforter of one of the beds. When we went to take it off, we found a hair on the sheet. We asked the front desk to change all the linens on the bed, which they did. However, when we looked under/behind the bed it was filthy!! Dirt, hair, dust, etc. The bathroom was tiny and filthy as well. The floor of the bathroom hadn't been swept and the tub needed a good scrubbing! It was just disgusting! We were hoping to swim in the pool but after seeing the condition of the room, we did not trust the cleanliness of the pool. We come to Kittery once a year but we will never stay here again!
reviews.title: Filthy!!

reviews.text: Stayed here with my family thinking it was a Best Western, how bad can it be? This place is the pits!! Room 101 smells so bad. Mold issues going on for a while and nothing has ever been done about it. The front desk could care less, they seemed like this was the first time they ever heard of such a problem. Stayed at an awful lot of hotels/models, but nothing compares to this place. Stinky, stinky, stinky!! Mold like you would never believe or imagine. Stay away, I'm telling ya!!!
reviews.title: This place stinks!! Trust me, anywhere else would be better!! Moldy, Moldy, Moldy!!!!! Room 101 stinks something awful.

reviews.text: We stayed her for just one night over Memorial Day weekend. We booked thru the hotel's site and got a AAA discounted rate. Upon check in, we were blown away by how clean and modern the hotel was. Our room was huge! More than enough room for us and our two year old. We took advantage of the indoor pool, free parking, and free breakfast...what more can you ask for?
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: Front desk agents were very nice and friendly. I just didn't understand why we were put at the far end of the hotel when there were only a handful of people staying there. Anyway, the room was decent and the AC was icy cold! There was a fridge in the room but it didn't work. Carpet didn't look like it was vacuumed and there was a stain on our bed spread. Other then that, the room was fine except for the very very small bathroom. Hallways were very clean, did not hear any noise while we were there. The pool area was also clean but don't plan on relaxing in the hot tub because there isn't one. The free breakfast was great! If you stay here make sure you eat the waffles! Our AAA rate was only $71.99 plus tax, not bad at all for the money and you are pretty close to everything. I hope this helps you in your decision.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This BW is standard for hotels located near Kittery Maine, the outlet mall center of Maine, on 95 for your trips north or south, we have not noticed traffic. We have stayed here a few times as they have a number of rooms that are clean but small.
reviews.title: Roadside hotel on 95

reviews.text: Don't expect much and you will be satisfied.
reviews.title: Not nearly as bad as some reviews suggest

reviews.text: Location: it's conveniently located for Kittery Outlet Shopping as well as access to beaches.
reviews.title: April Fools--NO JOKE! Discusting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was amazing for what it was. from the outside it does not look like much but the rooms are clean and nice. the breakfast is basic but good. and the people are to say the least accommodating. they made the stay! we had our entire wedding party here and they were all happy. close to the highway close to the town and close to the beach. i really cannot put to words how happy i was with this place. other closer places i looked at seemed nicer but way more uptight and they did not have fridges in each room...this place did. if you are not expecting the ritz this place you will be happy with!
reviews.title: All my wedding party stayed here

reviews.text: We were going for a 2.5 star on priceline and got York Best Western. This is not a 2.5 star hotel. I waited for quite some time to check in, even though I was the only one at the front desk. There are no elevators, so you have to haul the luggage up stairs. The rooms were substandard in appearance and bed quality, with incredibly small bathrooms. We did go swimming in the indoor pool which was nice, but that didn't make up for everything else. Breakfast was marginal. We usually do really well on priceline, but got burned on this one.
reviews.title: Not great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a popular weekend in October (possibly for leaf-peepers.) We were required to book at least 2 nights for this weekend. We hadn't planned to do this, but it was hard to find another hotel in the area that was reputable. It looked very nice on the outside, however, the inside wasn't as nice. It smelled of fresh paint as soon as we walked in. The bathroom was so small that our arm was bumping into the toilet paper roll when we sat on the toilet. The tub looked like it needed a good scrubbing, and it had a cigarette burn on the edge of it. The room was non-smoking but definitely smelled like someone had smoked in there recently. We took a look at the indoor pool and decided not to use it...just didn't look real clean. The breakfast bar was ok but didn't have a big variety. The first night we were woke up by someone in the next room coughing. Obviously, the walls weren't too sound-proof. There wasn't even a pot for the coffee maker. You just had to put a cup under it! There was a nice fridge in the room but no microwave, which was ok with us. The bed was fairly comfortable but didn't seem too big for a queen. I didn't think it was a very good value for the price we paid.
reviews.title: Not worth the price we paid

reviews.text: The only complaint I have is that on the surface the room looked clean but if you looked along the edges of the floor or behind the sofa, all kinds of fun stuff was found from hair and lint to items past guests have lost (pacifier, hair clip, crayon..). The staff was very friendly and the location was nice. I would have given a better rating if someone had gone through the room with the crack and crevice tool on the vacuum cleaner!
reviews.title: Nice rooms but could have been cleaner.

reviews.text: This hotel is just OK - but the rooms are a hidden gem - so I'm rating it 5 stars to offset the bad reviews. It is big and we got lost getting to our room. The elevators are clear on opposite corners of the building which makes for a lot of walking. The first hall we walked down needed serious vacuuming - but I think in retrospect we accidently went down a utility hallway. As we got closer to what appeared to be the rooms - the halls were clean and everything looked nice. When we got into our room I was VERY pleasantly surprised. The room was newly remodeled and the bathroom was not only emaculate - but it was sparkling clean. I am a stickler for clean showers and bathrooms - and I was not disappointed. We had to use a rollaway because of the size of our group - and I slept on the rollaway. Surprisingly it was the best sleep of my trip.
reviews.title: Fantastic Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at this Best Western but never again. The room was of good size and well organized but the bathroom was filthy. The bottom of the shower current was covered with black mold and blood stains on the tile next to the toilet. The fitted sheets did not fit the bed at all. No pen and paper in the room, of which my asked for some, but never got. For those who are early risers and wish to leave the room and have coffee so your spouse may sleep, forget it. They serve breakfast at seven and will not turn on the coffee before that. The desk clerk was very rude about this when I asked, being told I have a coffee maker in the room and not caring that I didn’t want to wake my wife. I had get in my car and drive to a convenience store to get coffee.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Best Western should not have their name being that they have a roach motel quality!
reviews.title: Overall decent stay

reviews.text: NEVER again
reviews.title: Look for another hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for one night while traveling to old orchard beach. I kept reading reviews and gettign detered from staying at hotels in the portland area, I finally settled and called AAA and booked a room here at the york inn, I did not read the reviews before my stay so I wouldnt be detered. When I checked in the staff was very friendly and helpful. I got a non smoking room, and as many have said in other reviews my room had a slight odor to it, like it could possibly have been a smoking room in the past, not strong, just a faint smell. The room was clean as well as the bathroom(unlike other reviews it was clean). The mattress was firm and not so comfortable, and the fitted sheet did not fit, may have been for a full size, our bed was a queen. Overall the stay was ok, clean room, quiet, convienient. I would say with a diff matress and a fresh smell it would be a good room, the rate was a little high but cant ask for much since its summer tourist season, $153/night.
reviews.title: Ok stay for a couple of nights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Saying our room was dirty was an understatement. There was food left on the floor by prior guest, the tv hardly worked at all, the light socket was falling out of the wall, the tub didn't drain and was filled with other people's hair balls....staff was NOT helpful at all and the pool smelled like dirty feet. For the price we paid I was shocked!
reviews.title: Awful Place Don't stay there
